intro: Phelipanche borissovae, commonly known as the Bulgarian common morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual that produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pale purple or white. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy stems, which help it to cling to surfaces. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and have a slightly rough texture. Phelipanche borissovae is native to regions of southern Europe and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
